revised_title: The Existence of Multiple Fungi in Madura Disease (Mycetoma)
tldr: This study investigates the presence of multiple fungi in Mycetoma, a chronic inflammatory disease characterized by tissue destruction and the formation of granulation tissue. The researchers examine specimens of both black and white particles found in Mycetoma and identify two distinct fungi, one responsible for the black particles and the other for the white particles. They also discuss the tissue reactions and the transformation of the fungi within the affected tissues.
